thread.title: There’s More to the Fires, Terrorism in Chile - WSJ
thread.title_full: There’s More to the Fires, Terrorism in Chile - WSJ

title: There’s More to the Fires, Terrorism in Chile - WSJ
text:
Letters There’s More to the Fires, Terrorism in Chile The former Commander in Chief of the Navy declared that the government had information regarding who is behind the fires, but lacked the political will to act accordingly. Feb. 21, 2017 7:09 p.m. ET 
Ambassador Juan Gabriel Valdés’s Feb. 13 letter criticizing Mary Anastasia O’Grady’s “Fire and Terrorism in Chile” (Americas, Feb. 6) should know that Roberto Cornejo, the president of the Chilean College of Forestry Engineers, recently stated that a large part of the fires had been caused intentionally, and he explicitly rejected the ambassador’s claim that climate change was the main reason for the catastrophe. 
Strikingly, the ambassador doesn’t seem to know about the official documents of the Colombian government... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Most Popular Videos
